intro: Silene wahlbergella subsp. arctica, commonly known as Arctic campion, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. It is a low-growing perennial that typically forms a dense mat of foliage. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in cold, nutrient-poor environments, often found on tundra and rocky soils. Its botanical features include hairy stems and leaves adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions.
